verbs.description: typify (third-person singular simple present typifies, present participle typifying, simple past and past participle typified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To embody, exemplify; to represent by an form, image, model, or resemblance.
examples: His attitude typifies the attitude of young people today.
The angry captain typified all new sailors as incompetent.

entries.meaning: (transitive, sciences) To serve as a typical or reference specimen of.
examples: The chosen specimen typifies plants belonging to that species.
